intro: Mussaenda mollissima, commonly known as silky Mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of showy, yellowish-white bracts that resemble flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Mussaenda mollissima is typically evergreen and can reach heights of up to 3 meters.
